document.docAuthor: Oliveira, Fábio G. L., Cipola, Nikolas G. & Almeida, Eduardo A. B.
document.docTitle: Salina bicolor Oliveira¹ & Cipola² & Almeida¹ 2020, sp.n.
document.masterDocTitle: Systematics and biogeography of Salina MacGillivray (Collembola: Entomobryoidea), with emphasis on the species groups in the New World

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Systematics and biogeography of Salina MacGillivray (Collembola: Entomobryoidea), with emphasis on the species groups in the New World

subSubSection.paragraph: Head to Abd VI laterally with one black longitudinal band; Ant I with 4 mac; cephalic groove only 2 serrated mic and 1 smooth chaeta; Th II–Abd I with 1, 2, 2 central mac, respectively; Abd III with 6 lateral mac ( a7 , am6 , pm6 , p6 , p7i and one unnamed); Abd IV with 7 central mac ( Ae1 absent) and 9 lateral mac; collophore with 7 anterior, 4 posterior and 14 lateral flap chaetae; trochanteral organ with 12 spine-like chaetae; manubrial plate with 3 chaetae.

Salina

Salina brasiliana

; (B),

sp.n.
; (H),
S. tocantinensis
sp.n.
; (I),
S. unisetosa
sp.n.
(J–K), distal tibiotarsus and foot complex (posterior side): (J), fore leg; (K), hind leg.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype ♂ on slide (ICN/ UNAL ): Colombia , Guaviare Department , San José del Guaviare municipality, “ Playa Güio ”, 02°34’06”N , 72°41’36”W , Amazon Forest ,
179 m
,
20.iv.2013
, Malaise-trap, Animal Taxonomy students coll
.
Total length (head + trunk) of holotype 1.58 mm. Specimen pale white with black pigments on basal and distal Ant I, eyepatches, and one longitudinal band on each side of head to Abd VI ( Figure 9C ).

Head. Ant II–IV missing; Ant I dorsally with 4 mac and 6 basal spiny smooth mic ( Figure 10C ). Posterior labial chaetotaxy series ‘CG’ with 4–5 ciliate chaetae (
CG 1-3
,
CG 5
,
CG 7
), 1 smooth chaeta (
CG 6p
), and 2 serrated mic (
CG 4
and
CG 6
); series ‘PLM’ with 2 ciliate chaetae (
PLM 1–2
); series ‘PLE’ with 2 ciliate chaetae (
PLE 1–2
); lateral side with about 15 ciliate chaetae ( Figure 11C ).

Dorsal chaetotaxy. Th II with 1 ‘p’ mac ( p3 ). Th III with 2 ‘p’ mac ( p2–3 ) ( Figure 12C ). Abd I with 2 ‘p’ mac ( m3 , m4 ) ( Figure 13C ). Abd III with 1 ‘a’ mac ( a7 ), 2 ‘m’ mac ( am6 , pm6 ), and 3 ‘p’ mac ( p6 , p7i and one unnamed) (similar to
S. brasiliana
sp.n.
, Figure 14A ). Abd IV with 2 ‘A’ mac ( A1 , A6 ); 1 ‘Ae’ mes ( Ae1 ); 3 ‘B’ mac ( B3–5 ); 1 ‘Be’ mac ( Be1 ); 1 ‘C’ mac ( C1) ; 1 ‘E’ mac ( E1 ); 4 ‘F’ mac ( F1–F3p ); 4 ‘Fe’ mac ( Fe1–3 , Fe6 ); posterior side with 3 sens type IV ( ps and two unnamed) ( Figure 14G ). Abd V with 4 ‘a’ mac ( a0 , a3 , a5–6 ); 4 ‘m’ mac ( m0 , m2–3 , m5 ); and 6 ‘p’ mac ( p0-5 ) ( Figure 15C ).

Salina bicolor
sp.n.
resembles
S. greensladeae Yoshii & Suhardjono, 1989
from Indonesia , by head to Abd VI with a black longitudinal band from each side, Th II–Abd I with 1, 2, 2 central mac, respectively, and others general characteristics (see Yoshii & Greenslade 1993: 78 ). However,
S. bicolor
sp.n.
differs from this species by sublobal plate with 3 appendages (atypical 1 in
S. greensladeae
), collophore with 7 anterior chaetae ( 11 in
S. greensladeae
) and 4 posterior smooth chaetae (6 ciliated in
S. greensladeae
), and mucro with 4 teeth ( 3 in
S. greensladeae
).
Salina bicolor
sp.n.
also differs by despigmented legs, while
S. greensladeae
has a band on femur and tibiotarsus. For additional information, refer to Table 2 .
